thread.title: Miami one of the world's worst cities for traffic congestion, study finds - Sun Sentinel
thread.title_full: Miami one of the world's worst cities for traffic congestion, study finds - Sun Sentinel

author: Selima Hussain
title: Miami one of the world's worst cities for traffic congestion, study finds - Sun Sentinel
text:
Miami one of the world's worst cities for traffic congestion, study finds Traffic Associated Press According to a new study from Inrix, Miami is one of the most traffic congested cities in the United States -- and around the world. According to a new study from Inrix, Miami is one of the most traffic congested cities in the United States -- and around the world. (Associated Press) Selima Hussain to back it up. According to Inrix, a company that specializes in transportation analytics and mobile apps, Miami has the fifth-worst traffic congestion in the United States.
Miami is also the 10th most congested city globally, according to the study. 
“A stable U.S. economy, continued urbanization of major cities, and factors such as employment growth and low gas prices have all contributed to increased traffic in 2016,” said Bob Pishue, senior economist at Inrix. Caption More news stories you might be interested in

Whales are beaching themselves on the tip of the South Island of New Zealand. Caption Where American immigrants living here illegally reside 
Nearly 10% of the nation’s 11.1 million immigrants who are in the country illegally reside in Los Angeles and Orange counties, according to an analysis by the Pew Research Center. 
Nearly 10% of the nation’s 11.1 million immigrants who are in the country illegally reside in Los Angeles and Orange counties, according to an analysis by the Pew Research Center. 
Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco and Atlanta top the list of most congested cities in the United States. Miami ranks above Washington D.C., Dallas, Boston, Chicago and Seattle, the study says. 
Miamians spent 65 hours in traffic and had an overall congestion rate of 8.7 percent in 2016. The congestion rate is the percentage of total drive time spent in traffic congestion during peak and non-peak hours. 
The congestion rate in Los Angeles, which was ranked the worst city for traffic in the United States and the world, was 12.7 percent. 
In order to come up with the rankings, Inrix analyzed 500 terabytes of data covering more than 5 million miles of road, according to a press release.
